docs.text: the makers of jurassic park & the director of speed conjure up a storm !
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( reviewed at eng wah's new jubilee cineplex at ang mo kio )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " unlike earthquakes , their fury is precise .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: unlike hurricanes , their reach is unlimited .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: unlike fires , there is no way to combat them .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: unlike floods , their terror is sudden . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: - excerpt from twister production notes
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i'm sure many of us living in this part of the world have never seen tornadoes ( or twisters ) before .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i for one , have only seen the devastating effects and footage of tornadoes from news reports on tv and personally , i feel tornado-caused destruction comes no where near the destruction caused by hurricanes and earthquakes . . . . . . . . that is until i saw twister .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the destruction caused by twisters may be precise ( not widespread but it moves very fast and its path of destruction is unpredictable .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it will suck in cars , houses , livestock , etc . . . . .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: basically anything in its path that is not firmly rooted to the ground and in twister , you'll get to see all this - close up !
docs.label: positive

docs.text: twister tells a tale about a group of storm chasers .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: these people are basically out-of-their-mind and for the sake of obtaining data on twister-occurrences , they risk their lives by literally chasing tornadoes , trying to get as close as they can . . . . . that
docs.label: positive

docs.text: is if the tornado does not suddenly decide to change its path towards them !
docs.label: positive

docs.text: jo ( helen hunt ) is the leader of this pack of kamikazes .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: while they are gearing up for the mother-of-all-storms as predicted by satellite recon , bill ( bill paxton ) , a former co- leader of the team returns to settle some divorce papers with jo .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: apparently , bill has left his rogue-ish days for greener and more practical pastures - as a television weatherman .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he catches up with his old-self and follows the pack like the good ole days , bringing his wife-to-be melissa ( jamie gertz ) along , a city-bred woman toting around with a handphone .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: jo has finally implemented bills initial idea of a device called dorothy which measurement's of a twister may lead to a better understanding on how tornadoes are formed so that a more reliable early-warning system can be implemented .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the problem is , the device has to be placed very near the twister , and in its path ( which is practically unpredictable ) of destruction in order for it to function .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: to add to their current challenge , there is another group of storm chasers that is corporation-funded led by jonas ( cary elwes ) and they too have a similar device .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: thus begins the race ; jo's cheap government equipment with beaten-up vehicles against jonas's high-tech computers and satellite link-ups with their sleek , black all-terrain vans .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: plot wise , there are not really anything to shout about .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: twister is as predictable as any summer box-office hit can get .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there is the danger of the twister , the competition with jonas^os more well-off team and of course , the settling of differences between jo and bill ( this part gives the film its human substance ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: helen hunt , bill paxton and the rest of the actors/actresses give only average performances and all of them take back seat to the main thespian in this movie - the twister itself !
docs.label: positive

docs.text: thanks to the impressive digital effects by ilm ( lucasfilm's industrial light and magic ) , we get to see the terror and destruction caused by tornadoes up close ; from stripping barns and houses to lifting up livestock !
docs.label: positive

docs.text: jan de bont once again proves his visual abiility ( thanks to his years of experience as a director of photography for action films ) for action sequences .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: like his previous film speed , the tornado sequences ( which are essentially the action sequences ) are well visualised and edited .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: audiences will be holding tight to their chairs everytime a tornado comes on screen !
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the surround sound effects sure does help a lot in stressing the terror of a twister !
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( the cinema must at the very least support digital sound to fully appreciate this ) twister is definitely an effect-dependent movie .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: now that id4 fever has begun to reside , and people are getting bored of watching will smith whoop et's ass for the umpteenth time . . . . . . twister is your sure bet of 7 bucks well spent !
docs.label: positive

docs.text: watch it in a good theatre . . . please .
docs.label: positive

docs.label: positive

docs.label: positive

docs.label: positive

docs.text: see it twice .
